page.title: 19LADIES DAY, NESTON
page.content: The Neston Friendly Society was formed in 1814 to help the poor and needy women of Neston during the Napoleonic War.It is an all female society apart from the secretary who is male.It was the first to be formed in Britain and is now the only one left in this country.On the first Thursday in June a Ladies Day Walk is held.The society which runs the procession is a self help assurance organisation offering death, sickness and maternity benefits in return for a small subscription of around seven pence a month.The procession is the club's annual meeting.Ladies Day is a social occasion.Arranged to coincide with the procession is the arrival of the fair (an annual event).The children are given free tickets for rides as a thankyou for taking part in the parade. p.t.o.
